Entries.AgedRoe_Description: Fish eggs aged in salt to bring out the flavour.
Entries.Alamite_Description: Its distinctive fluorescence makes it a favourite among rock collectors.
Entries.Amaranth_Description: A purple grain cultivated by an ancient civilisation.
Entries.AppleSapling_Description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Apple tree. Bears fruit in the autumn. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.
Entries.ArtifactSpot_Description: Uh... how did you get this in your inventory? Ape made a booboo.
Entries.BananaPudding_Description: A creamy dessert with a wonderful tropical flavour.
Entries.BerryBasket_Description: The fibres are stained with berry juice.
Entries.Bixite_Description: A dark metallic mineral sought after for its cubic structure.
Entries.BlueDiscus_Description: A brightly coloured tropical fish that is popular in aquariums.
Entries.BokChoySeeds_Description: Plant these in the autumn. Takes 4 days to mature.
Entries.BrokenGlasses_Description: It looks like someone lost their glasses. They're broken.
Entries.Cauliflower_Description: Valuable, but slow-growing. Despite its pale colour, the florets are packed with nutrients.
Entries.Chanterelle_Description: A tasty mushroom with a fruity smell and slightly peppery flavour.
Entries.Corn_Description: One of the most popular grains. The sweet, fresh cobs are a summer favourite.
Entries.CranberrySeeds_Description: Plant these in the autumn. Takes 7 days to mature, and continues to produce after first harvest.
Entries.DragonTooth_Description: These are rumoured to be the teeth of ancient serpents. The enamel is made of pure iridium!
Entries.DressedSpinner_Description: The metal tab and colourful streamers create an enticing spectacle for fish. Increases the bite-rate when fishing.
Entries.DwarfGadget_Description: It's a piece of the advanced technology once known to the dwarfs. It's still glowing and humming, but you're unable to understand how it works.
Entries.DwarfScrollI_Description: A yellowed scroll of parchment filled with Dwarfish script. This one's tied with a red bow.
Entries.DwarfScrollII_Description: A yellowed scroll of parchment filled with Dwarfish script. This one's tied with a green ribbon.
Entries.DwarfScrollIII_Description: A yellowed scroll of parchment filled with Dwarfish script. This one's tied with a blue rope.
Entries.DwarfScrollIV_Description: A yellowed scroll of parchment filled with Dwarfish script. This one's tied with a golden chain.
Entries.DwarvishHelm_Description: It's one of the helmets commonly worn by dwarfs. The thick metal plating protects them from falling debris and stalactites.
Entries.EggplantSeeds_Description: Plant these in the autumn. Takes 5 days to mature, and continues to produce after first harvest.
Entries.ElvishJewelry_Description: Dirty but still beautiful. On the side is a flowing script thought by some to be the ancient language of the elves. No Elfin bones have ever been found.
Entries.Emerald_Description: A precious stone with a brilliant green colour.
Entries.Enricher_Description: Place on a sprinkler and load with fertiliser to automatically apply it when planting seeds nearby.
Entries.FairySeeds_Description: Plant in autumn. Takes 12 days to produce a mysterious flower. Assorted colours.
Entries.FallSeeds_Description: An assortment of wild autumn seeds.
Entries.FiddleheadRisotto_Description: A creamy rice dish served with saut√©d fern heads. It's a little bland.
Entries.Garlic_Description: Adds a wonderful zest to dishes. High quality garlic can be pretty spicy.
Entries.GingerAle_Description: A zesty drink known for its soothing effect on the stomach.
Entries.GourmetTomatoSalt_Description: A rare, delicious and savoury salt.
Entries.GrapeStarter_Description: Plant these in the autumn. Takes 10 days to grow, but keeps producing after that. Grows on a trellis.
Entries.GreenTea_Description: A pleasant, energising beverage made from lightly processed tea leaves.
Entries.Hematite_Description: An iron-based mineral with interesting magnetic properties.
Entries.Hops_Description: A bitter, tangy flower used to flavour beer.
Entries.HotPepper_Description: Fiery hot with a hint of sweetness.
Entries.LemonStone_Description: Some claim the powdered crystal is a dwarfish delicacy.
Entries.MagicRockCandy_Description: A rare and powerful sweet infused with the essence of the prismatic shard.
Entries.Mango_Description: A big, sweet tropical fruit with a unique flavour.
Entries.MovieTicket_Description: Admits one to the cinema. Giving this to a friend invites them to the cinema with you.
Entries.OrnamentalFan_Description: This exquisite fan most likely belonged to a noblewoman. Historians believe that the valley was a popular sixth-era holiday spot for the wealthy.
Entries.Orpiment_Description: Despite its high toxicity, this mineral is widely used in manufacturing and folk medicine.
Entries.PaleBroth_Description: A delicate broth with a hint of sulphur.
Entries.Pancakes_Description: A double stack of American-style fluffy, soft pancakes.
Entries.PinkCake_Description: There are little heart sweets on top.
Entries.Poi_Description: A traditional food with a delicate, sweet flavour when eaten fresh.
Entries.PomegranateSapling_Description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Pomegranate tree. Bears fruit in the autumn. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.
Entries.Poppy_Description: In addition to its colourful flower, the poppy has culinary and medicinal uses.
Entries.Pumpkin_Description: An autumn favourite, grown for its crunchy seeds and delicately flavoured flesh. As a bonus, the hollow shell can be carved into a Spirit's Even decoration.
Entries.PumpkinSeeds_Description: Plant these in the autumn. Takes 13 days to mature.
Entries.QiGem_Description: A special currency honoured by Mr. Qi.
Entries.RainbowTrout_Description: A freshwater trout with colourful markings.
Entries.RareSeed_Description: Sow in autumn. Takes all season to grow.
Entries.RedCabbage_Description: Often used in salads and coleslaws. The colour can range from purple to blue to green-yellow depending on soil conditions.
Entries.RedSnapper_Description: A popular fish with a nice red colour.
Entries.RoastedHazelnuts_Description: The roasting process creates a rich forest flavour.
Entries.Roe_Description: Fresh fish eggs. These can be aged in a preserves jar to bring out more flavour.
Entries.Ruby_Description: A precious stone that is sought after for its rich colour and beautiful lustre.
Entries.RustyCog_Description: A well preserved cog that must have been part of some ancient machine. This could be dwarfish technology.
Entries.Salmonberry_Description: A spring-time berry with the flavour of the forest.
Entries.ShrimpCocktail_Description: A sumptuous appetiser made with freshly-caught prawns.
Entries.SpangleSeeds_Description: Plant in summer. Takes 8 days to produce a vibrant tropical flower. Assorted colours.
Entries.SpiritTorch_Description: It's unclear where the blue colour comes from...
Entries.Stardrop_Description: A mysterious fruit that empowers those who eat it. The flavour is like a dream... a powerful personal experience, yet difficult to describe to others.
Entries.StirFry_Description: Julienne vegetables on a bed of rice.
Entries.Strawberry_Description: A sweet, juicy favourite with an appealing red colour.
Entries.Sugar_Description: Adds sweetness to pastries and sweets. Too much can be unhealthy.
Entries.SunflowerSeeds_Description: Plant in summer or autumn. Takes 8 days to produce a large sunflower. Yields more seeds at harvest.
Entries.TeaLeaves_Description: The young leaves of the tea plant. Can be brewed into the popular, energising beverage.
Entries.Tigerseye_Description: A stripe of shimmering gold gives this gem a warm lustre.
Entries.TulipBulb_Description: Plant in spring. Takes 6 days to produce a colourful flower. Assorted colours.
Entries.Weeds_DryBush_Description: A cluster of dry old bushes. Might contain fibres or mixed seeds.
Entries.Weeds_FiberOrMixedSeeds_Description: Might contain fibres or mixed seeds.
Entries.Weeds_FiberOrMixedSeeds_Ugly_Description: Ugly weeds. Might contain fibres or mixed seeds.
Entries.YamSeeds_Description: Plant these in the autumn. Takes 10 days to mature.
